legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Winter CIS

blocks.page_title: Introduction Section - Participant Confirmation

title.text: Are you completing the questions on behalf of {first_name}?

description.text:
For example, you are a parent or guardian completing the questions for a child.

Please note, throughout this questionnaire "you" refers to {first_name}.

blocks.page_title: Introduction Section - Completing for someone else

question.title: There has been a problem accessing the survey

description.text:
This questionnaire is intended for {first_name}. You have indicated that you are not {first_name} or completing the questionnaire on behalf of them.

If this is correct, please:

1.Tick the continue box and then select “Save and continue”.

2.On the next page, select the “Submit” button to submit the questionnaire.

3.Call the helpline on 0808 196 1270. You will need your Participant ID. You can find your participant ID in your window notification email. The survey team member on the phone will tell you what to do next.

If you are {first_name}, or completing the questions on behalf of them:

1.Select “< Previous” two times. You can find this at the top left-hand side of this page, underneath the blue banner that says “Winter CIS”.

2.You will then need to amend the answers to be able to complete the survey.

blocks.page_title: Introduction Section - Access error message

question.title: Is this the first Winter CIS questionnaire you are completing?

blocks.page_title: About You - Winter CIS

options.value: Any other Mixed or Multiple background

options.value: Any other Black, Black British, African or Caribbean background

question.title: Which one best describes your other ethnic group or background?

blocks.page_title: About You - Other ethnic group

question.title: How many people live in your household in the following age groups (including yourself)?
description:
By household, we mean the group of people you live with, in a single house or dwelling.

Please enter the number of people in your household for each age group.

Enter a number for each age group, including zero where needed.

blocks.page_title: About You - Your Household
Your lateral flow test result

contents.description: This section will ask about the lateral flow test we have asked you to take in this testing window.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions "you" refers to {first_name}.

question.title: Have you successfully taken your lateral flow test?
description:
If you are planning to take your test but have not yet done so, please exit the questionnaire and return when you have taken it.

If the test result was void, please take another test.

options.label: No - I have run out of useable lateral flow tests
options.value: No - I have run out of useable lateral flow tests

blocks.page_title: Test Result - Lateral flow test taken

in: No - I have run out of useable lateral flow tests

question.title: On which date did you take your lateral flow test?

blocks.page_title: Test Result - Date lateral flow test taken

question.title: What was the result of your lateral flow test?

blocks.page_title: Test Result - Result

question.title: Do you have any symptoms that you think were caused or made worse by this COVID-19 infection?
description: We will ask you to tell us what these symptoms are later.

blocks.page_title: Test Result - Do you have symptoms

question.title: What was the earliest date that any of these symptoms related to your current COVID-19 infection started?
description: If you cannot remember exactly, make your best guess.

blocks.page_title: Test result - Symptoms start date

question.title: What date do you think you became infected with COVID-19?
description: If you are unsure, make your best guess.

blocks.page_title: Test Results - Infection date

question.title: Positive lateral flow test
description:
As you have reported a positive test result, we now ask you to continue to test every other day until you have two consecutive negative test results two days apart.

We will email you a link within the next five days to complete a short, follow-up questionnaire.

Please keep a note of the date you take each lateral flow test and the result, so that you can enter this information into the follow-up questionnaire.

Please click "continue" to continue with this questionnaire.

blocks.page_title: Test Result - Positive lateral flow test

question.title: Please complete this questionnaire even though you could not successfully take a lateral flow test
description:
Thank you for letting us know about your test kits. Unfortunately we cannot send more or replacement lateral flow tests.

Please click "continue" to continue with this questionnaire.

blocks.page_title: Test Result - no test
Work and education section - intoduction

contents.description: This section is about work and education.
We ask these questions to understand the risk of current and past respiratory infections depending on where you work or study.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions "you" refers to {first_name}.

question.title: Are you aged 16 or over?

blocks.page_title: Work and Education - Aged 16 years or over

question.title: What is your current work, education or other status? That is where you spend most of your time, even if you are currently absent.
description: If for example, you are working and studying, please tell us where you spend most of your time.

options.label: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work
options.value: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work

in: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work

For example, primary school teacher, car mechanic, district nurse, structural engineer.

Do not include the name or location of your company.

For example, a cleaner working in a school should select "Teaching and Education" but "Healthcare" if working in a hospital.

Police Officers and Fire Fighters should select "Civil Service or Local Government".

description: If currently unwell, choose where you would usually work when not unwell.

If currently unwell, choose what you would usually do when not unwell.

Choose 0 if home-schooled.

If you use multiple types of transport, choose the transport you use for the longest part of your journey in time.

If you are working and studying, answer based on where you spend most of your time.

options.value: Underground or Metro or Light Rail or Tram

summary.page_title: New Section - Your health Status Today

blocks.page_title: Health Status Section - Introduction

contents.description: This section asks about how your health has been recently. This provides important information that helps inform policies to protect the country.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions "you" refers to {first_name}.

question.title: Have you had any of the following symptoms in the last 7 days?
description: You will be asked about other symptoms on the next page.

contents.description: Include all the symptoms you have experienced:

list: regardless of the cause, for example, symptoms relating the general health, age or recent work or exercise
even if you experience them regularly as part of a long-term health condition

options.label: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual
options.value: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Symptoms in last 7 days

question.title: Have you had any of these other symptoms in the last 7 days?

contents.description: Include all the symptoms you have experienced:

list: regardless of the cause, for example, symptoms relating to general health, age or recent work or exercise
even if you experience them regularly as part of a long-term health condition

options.label: Low mood or not enjoying anything
options.value: Low mood or not enjoying anything

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Other symptoms in last 7 days

question.title: Which of these symptoms are new or worse than usual for you?
description: If your symptoms are experienced as part of a long-term health condition, only include those that have been worse than usual for you.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Any symptoms new or worse

question.title: And which of these symptoms are new or worse than usual for you?
description: If your symptoms are experienced as part of a long-term health condition, only include those that have been worse than usual for you.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Any other symptoms new or worse

question.title: What was the earliest date that any of these symptoms became worse than usual for you, or first started if they are new?
description:
Enter the earliest date, including if this was more than 7 days ago.

If the symptoms are new, please select the date that they first started.

If the symptoms are regularly experienced as a part of a long-term health condition, please select the date they got worse than normal for you.

If you cannot remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you cannot make a best guess, put the 15th.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Onset of symptoms or their worsening

question.title: Do you have long-term physical or mental health conditions or illnesses lasting or expected to last 12 months or more?
description: Please do not include long COVID symptoms (we ask about these later) but include things like diabetes, heart disease, asthma, and depression.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Long-term conditions

question.title: Do any of these conditions or illnesses reduce your ability to carry-out day-to-day activities?
description: Do not include any effects of long COVID alone, we ask about this later.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Reduced ability to carry-out activities

question.title: In the past 28 days, did you look after or give any help or support to anyone because they have long-term physical or mental health conditions or illnesses, or problems related to old age?
description: Exclude anything you do as part of your paid employment.

options.label: Yes - 9 hours a week or less
options.value: Yes - 9 hours a week or less

options.label: Yes - 50 or more hours a week
options.value: Yes - 50 or more hours a week

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Unpaid Care Given

in: Yes - 9 hours a week or less
Yes - 50 or more hours a week

question.title: Do those who you look after or give any help or support to live inside or outside your household?

options.label: I provide support to people from both inside and outside my household
options.value: I provide support to people from both inside and outside my household

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - unpaid care

question.title: Have you ever smoked cigarettes regularly?

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Ever smoked

question.title: Do you currently smoke or vape at all?

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Current smoking or vaping

question.title: Which of the following do you currently smoke or vape?

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Type of smoking

question.title: Have you been vaccinated against COVID-19 since 1st September 2023?
description: Answer "Yes" if you have received a first, second or later dose, or a booster dose, since 1st September 2023.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - COVID vaccination first Winter CIS

question.title: Have you been vaccinated against COVID-19 since you last completed this questionnaire?
description: Answer "Yes" if you have received a first, second or later dose, or a booster dose, since the last time you completed this questionnaire.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Recent COVID-19 vaccination

question.title: What was the type of the most recent COVID-19 vaccination you have had?
description: Answer for the type of your most recent dose or booster dose.

options.label: I do not know the type
options.value: I do not know the type

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Most recent vaccination type

question.title: How many doses of any COVID-19 vaccine have you received so far?
description: Include all COVID-19 vaccines, including those received as part of a trial, booster doses and any additional doses received due to being immunosuppressed.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - How many COVID-19 vaccination doses

question.title: What was the date of your most recent COVID-19 vaccination?
description: If you cannot remember the day of the month, put the 15th.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Date of COVID-19 vaccination

question.title: Have you been outside of the UK in the last 28 days?

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Travel outside UK since last questionnaire

question.title: What was the last country you visited?
description: Do not include airport layovers.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Last country visited

question.title: On what date did you last return to the UK?
description: If you cannot remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you cannot make a best guess, put the 15th.

blocks.page_title: Health Status Today - Return date

summary.page_title: New Section - Respiratory Infections and You

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections Section - Introduction

contents.description: The next section is about any experience you have had of any respiratory infections including coronavirus (COVID-19). This helps us to understand how these viruses are affecting society.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions "you" refers to {first_name}.

question.title: In the last 28 days, do you know or think that you have had a respiratory infection or illness?
description:
Respiratory infections or illnesses involve parts of the body involved in breathing, such as the sinuses / nose, throat, airways or lungs.

These include colds and infections such as flu, COVID-19 and chest infections. These can cause symptoms like a cough, sore throat, stuffy or runny nose, high temperature (fever), tiredness, changes to sense of taste or smell, muscle aches or shortness of breath.

Exclude pre-existing conditions, for example asthma.

We will use the term respiratory infection or illness throughout this questionnaire.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Whether you have had respiratory infection

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many days have you not been able to do usual daily activities for any personal health reasons?
description:
Include the days where you were not able to do something you would usually do because of your health on that day. This could be for any health reason.

For example, usual daily activities may be: housework, errands, going to work or school, going to clubs or classes.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Unable to do usual activities

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you were unable to do usual daily activities, how many days were due to respiratory infections you had?

description: For example, usual daily activities may be: housework, errands, going to work or school, going to clubs or classes.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Unable to do activities due to respiratory infection

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many days have you spent off work or education for any personal health reasons?
description: If you included a day in an earlier question, you can include it again here.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Off work or education for any health reason

in: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work
A child below school age and not attending a nursery or pre-school or childminder

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you spent off work or education, how many days were due to respiratory infections you had?

description: If you included a day in an earlier question, you can include it again here.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Off work of education due to respiratory infection

question.title: In the last 28 days, on how many days did you have an appointment at a GP surgery for any personal health reasons?

contents.description: Include:

list: in person, telephone, and online appointments
appointments with all GP healthcare staff, for example doctors and nurses
pre-booked appointments and drop in visits

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Appointment at GP surgery for any reason

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you had an appointment at a GP surgery, how many days were due to respiratory infections you had?

contents.description: Include:

list: in person, telephone, and online appointments
appointments with all GP healthcare staff, for example doctors and nurses
pre-booked appointments and drop in visits.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Appointment at GP surgery due to respiratory infection

question.title: In the last 28 days, on how many days have you spoken to a pharmacist or called 111 for advice about any personal health reasons?
description:
For example, if you called multiple times on one day, this would be 1.

Exclude contact about a repeat prescription.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Spoken to pharmacist or 111 for any health reason

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you spoke to a pharmacist or called 111, how many days were due to respiratory infections you had?

description:
For example, if you called multiple times on one day, this would be 1.

Exclude contact about a repeat prescription.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Spoken to pharmacist or 111 about respiratory infection

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many times have you attended urgent care for any personal health reasons?
description:
For example, A&E (accident and emergency), out of hours clinics, minor injuries, walk-in centres or urgent call outs.

Exclude hospital admissions or appointments.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Attended urgent care for any health reason

title.text: Out of the {number_of_times} times you attended urgent care, how many times were due to respiratory infections you had?

description:
For example, A&E (accident and emergency), out of hours clinics, minor injuries, walk-in centres or urgent call outs.

Exclude hospital admissions or appointments.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Attended urgent care due to respiratory infection

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many times have you been admitted to hospital?

contents.description: Include:

list: if you were admitted to hospital pre-planned, as an emergency or after attending A&E (accident and emergency)

contents.description: Exclude:

list: if you attended A&E and were then referred outside of the hospital or discharged without being admitted
hospital outpatient appointments

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Admitted to hospital for any health reason

title.text: Out of the {number_of_times} times you have been admitted to hospital, how many times were due to respiratory infections you had?

contents.description: Include:

list: if you were admitted to hospital pre-planned, as an emergency or after attending A&E (accident and emergency)

contents.description: Exclude:

list: if you attended A&E and were then referred outside of the hospital or discharged without being admitted
hospital outpatient appointments

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Admitted to hospital due to respiratory infection

question.title: Would you describe yourself as currently having long COVID? That is you are still experiencing symptoms more than 4 weeks after you first had the coronavirus (COVID-19), that are not explained by something else?

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Current long COVID

question.title: When did you first experience symptoms of long COVID?
description: If you cannot remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you cannot make a best guess, put the 15th.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Long COVID start date

question.title: Does this reduce your ability to carry out day-to-day activities compared with the time before you had COVID-19?

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Reduce ability to carry out activities

question.title: Do you have any of the following symptoms as part of your experience of long COVID?
description:
Only include pre-existing symptoms if long COVID has made these symptoms worse.

You will be asked about other symptoms on the following pages.

options.label: Problems with eyesight or sore eyes
options.value: Problems with eyesight or sore eyes

options.label: Palpitations or heart rate pounding or beating irregularly
options.value: Palpitations or heart rate pounding or beating irregularly

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Long COVID symptoms

question.title: And do you have any of these symptoms as part of your experience of long COVID?
description:
Only include pre-existing symptoms if long COVID has made these symptoms worse.

You will be asked about other symptoms on the following page.

options.label: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual
options.value: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Other long COVID symptoms continued

question.title: And do you have any of these symptoms as part of your experience of long COVID?
description: Only include pre-existing symptoms if long COVID has made these symptoms worse.

options.label: Low mood or not enjoying anything
options.value: Low mood or not enjoying anything

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Other long COVID symptoms

question.title: Do your symptoms tend to get worse after mental and/or physical effort?
description:
For example, completing a crossword, doing tasks on a computer, going for a walk or doing housework.

This includes if your symptoms get worse more so than you would usually expect based on the activity you are doing. The worsening could start hours or days after you undertook the activity.

blocks.page_title: Respiratory Infections and You - Symptoms made worse

summary.page_title: New Section - Contact with Other People

blocks.page_title: Contact with Other People Section - Introduction

contents.description: This section asks about your contact with other people.
We ask these questions to understand how contact with others across different settings affects the risk of current and past respiratory infections.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions "you" refers to {first_name}.

question.title: In the last 28 days, have you been inside a hospital for any reason?
description: For example, for work, for a consultation or treatment, to visit someone, to take someone else.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Been inside a hospital

question.title: In the last 28 days, have you been inside a hospice, care home or residential home for any reason?
description: For example, for work, to visit someone, or to take someone else.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Been inside a hospice, care home or residential home

question.title: Do you generally wear any kind of face covering or mask when you are in enclosed public spaces, such as shops, or using public transport?
description:
If you are currently unwell, choose what you would usually do when you are well.

Exclude places where masks are required, such as hospitals.

options.label: I do not go to enclosed public spaces or use public transport
options.value: I do not go to enclosed public spaces or use public transport

options.label: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons
options.value: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Wearing face masks in enclosed spaces

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many children and young people under 18 years old, who do not live in your home, have you had physical contact with?
description: For example, a handshake, hug, personal care or any social contact with physical touching.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Physical contact with under 18 year olds who are not household members

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many adults aged 18 to 69, who do not live in your home, have you had physical contact with?
description: For example, a handshake, hug, personal care or any social contact with physical touching.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Physical contact with 18 to 69 year olds who are not household members

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many older adults aged 70 years old and over, who do not live in your home, have you had physical contact with?
description: For example, a handshake, hug, personal care or any social contact with physical touching.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Physical contact with 70 year olds and over, who are not household members

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many children and young people under 18 years old, who do not live in your home, have you had direct but non-physical contact with in person?
description: For example, meeting a friend and going for coffee or a meal together.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Non-physical contact with under 18 year olds who are not household members

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many adults aged 18 to 69, who do not live in your home, have you had direct but non-physical contact with in person?
description: For example, meeting a friend and going for coffee or a meal together.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Non-physical contact with 18 to 69 year olds who are not household members

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many older adults aged 70 years old and over, who do not live in your home, have you had direct but non-physical contact with in person?
description: For example, meeting a friend and going for coffee or a meal together.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Non-physical contact with 70 year olds and over, who are not household member

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many times have you spent one hour or longer inside another person's home?
description:
This does not include their garden or doorstep.

For example, if you spent one hour or longer inside another person's home one day, and the next day you spent one hour or longer inside two different homes, you would select 3 times.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Time spent in another person's home

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many times has someone who doesn't live with you spent one hour or longer inside your home?
description:
This does not include your garden or doorstep.

For example, if two people spent one hour or longer in your home on one day, and three people spent one hour or longer in your home another day, you would select 2 times.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Non-household members spending time in your home

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many times have you been outside of your home for shopping?

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Times outside your home for shopping

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many times have you been outside of your home to socialise? Exclude going into other people's homes.
description: For example, going into restaurants or going to the cinema.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Times outside your home to socialise

question.title: In the last 28 days, on how many days have you taken part in high intensity indoor sports or exercise, near other people?
description: Only include where you are breathing heavily close to other people and the risk of spreading infections is high.

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Indoor exercise

question.title: In the last 28 days have you attended any large events with over 1,000 people?
description: If you are not sure how many other people were there, make your best guess.

contents.description: Include:

list: indoor and outdoor events. For example, sports events, festivals or concerts

contents.description: Exclude:

list: events with 1,000 people or less, as you will be asked about these next

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Attended events of over 1000 people

question.title: In the last 28 days have you attended any events with 100 to 1,000 people?
description: If you are not sure how many other people were there, make your best guess.

contents.description: Include:

list: indoor and outdoor events. For example, concerts, weddings, sports events, or conferences

contents.description: Exclude:

list: activities that are not events, such as going to the cinema, to restaurants or shopping

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Attended events of 100 to 1000 people

question.title: In the last 28 days, have you used any transport where you have shared with people outside of your home? Exclude travel to your place of work or education.
description: For example, to the shops, to a restaurant, to see family or to go to an appointment.

options.label: Underground or metro or light rail or tram
options.value: Underground or metro or light rail or tram

options.label: I have not used transport shared with people outside of my home for reasons other than travel to work or education
options.value: I have not used transport shared with people outside of my home for reasons other than travel to work or education

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Shared transport

question.title: Do you generally wear any kind of face covering or mask when you are at work or your place of education, because of respiratory infections?
description: If you are currently unwell, choose what you would usually do when you are well.

options.label: I am not going to my place of work or education
options.value: I am not going to my place of work or education

options.label: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons
options.value: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons

blocks.page_title: Contact with other people - Wearing face masks in work or education

question.title: The next few questions are being asked on behalf of the National Health Service (NHS England) to help their understanding of winter pressures on the NHS. The questions ask about your experience accessing GP care and waiting for NHS treatment. There are 8 questions, which will take around 3 minutes to complete.
description: Please note, we will not share your data with NHS England. We will only share the statistics produced on groups of respondents.

answers.label: Are you happy to answer these questions?

blocks.page_title: NHS Questions - intro

question.title: In the past month, have you tried to contact a GP practice for yourself or someone else?
description: This could be in person, on the phone or online.

blocks.page_title: NHS questions - GP contact

question.title: Thinking of the last time you tried to contact a GP practice, did you manage to make contact with them?
description: Making contact could include receiving a response from a receptionist or clinician or being able to book an appointment. This could be in person, on the phone or online.

options.label: Yes two or more days later
options.value: Yes two or more days later

options.label: No I did not manage to make contact with the GP practice
options.value: No I did not manage to make contact with the GP practice

blocks.page_title: NHS questions - GP contact success

question.title: Thinking of the last time you contacted a GP practice, how did you make contact?
description: If you tried multiple methods of contact, select the one that was successful.

options.label: By telephone speaking to a member of staff at the practice
options.value: By telephone speaking to a member of staff at the practice

options.label: Online through a GP practice website or app
options.value: Online through a GP practice website or app

options.label: Online through the NHS website or app
options.value: Online through the NHS website or app

blocks.page_title: NHS questions - How GP contact was made

question.title: How easy or difficult was it to contact the GP practice?

blocks.page_title: NHS question - GP access easy or difficult

question.title: Thinking of the last time you made contact with a GP practice, what did you understand the next step was?

options.label: I was given an appointment or assessment within 2 weeks of contact
options.value: I was given an appointment or assessment within 2 weeks of contact

options.label: I was given an appointment or assessment over 2 weeks after contact
options.value: I was given an appointment or assessment over 2 weeks after contact

options.label: I received what I needed online or by telephone
options.value: I received what I needed online or by telephone

options.label: To make contact again another day as the GP practice could not help that day
options.value: To make contact again another day as the GP practice could not help that day

options.label: Contact 111 as the GP practice could not help that day
options.value: Contact 111 as the GP practice could not help that day

options.label: To seek urgent treatment including Accident and Emergency and 999 services
options.value: To seek urgent treatment including Accident and Emergency and 999 services

options.label: To self-refer to another NHS service
options.value: To self-refer to another NHS service

options.label: I was not sure what the next step was
options.value: I was not sure what the next step was

blocks.page_title: NHS questions - GP contact next steps

question.title: Overall, how would you describe your experience of the GP practice?

blocks.page_title: NHS questions - GP

question.title: Are you currently waiting for a hospital appointment, test, or to start receiving medical treatment through the NHS?

blocks.page_title: NHS questions - Awaiting appointment

question.title: And how long have you been waiting for a hospital appointment, test, or to start receiving medical treatment through the NHS?
description: If you are waiting to start treatment for multiple conditions, please tell us about the longest wait.

blocks.page_title: NHS questions - waiting for hospital appointment

question.title: Thank you, please continue to the next page to submit your questionnaire
description: This is the end of your questionnaire. Thank you very much for taking part.

blocks.page_title: Thank you

contents.description: If another household member wants to start their questionnaire using the same device
You will need to click the "leave this page" link below.
They will then need to log in using their unique 16 character access code in the email or letter they were sent.

submission.title: Submit your questionnaire
submission.warning: You cannot view your answers after submission
